Key Match Events: Harrison allowed a five-run inning in the 5th, giving up a single to Jackson Chourio, a double to Blake Perkins, and a two-run homer to William Contreras.
Pre-Game Insights: Giants manager Bob Melvin predicted Harrison might go six innings before the rough 5th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Harrison expressed frustration with his outing, saying he got out of rhythm and didn't make good pitches in the 5th. He also acknowledged the importance of scoring early for the starting pitcher.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Giants' loss put them 6 1/2 games out of the final NL Wild Card berth. San Francisco's offense was held in check by Freddy Peralta, who threw six scoreless innings.
Others: The Giants have not officially confirmed reports of placing players on waivers, including Thairo Estrada, Taylor Rogers, and Tyler Matzek.
